comment._content: See Tyrell Today group photographs of this site here: www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy/2678110067/in/pool-tyrr... and here: www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy/2678115497/in/pool-tyrr...

comment.author: 35951588@N07
comment._content: This photo must have  been taken  around 1880, as there is no clock tower yet.  The clock tower was added to James Barnet's revised plans in 1880 and was erected in 1887 as part of the first of many extensions that the GPO underwent over the years.

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney's older buildings and structures. , and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
beachcomberaustralia - that is a good find.

Henry King and Charles Bayliss must have stood within about a couple of metres of the same spot on different days to get almost identical perspectives.

It was a very photogenic building.
